Amazon อยู่ระหว่างการเจรจากับ OpenAI เพื่อพัฒนาโมเดล AI แบบกำหนดเองสำหรับ Alexa และผลิตภัณฑ์อื่นๆ

Amazon in talks with OpenAI to develop custom AI models for Alexa and broader product suite

2d ago//Estefano Gomez
general
AI

Summary

TH

อมาซอนอยู่ในการเจรจากับ OpenAI เพื่อพัฒนาโมเดล AI ที่กำหนดเองสำหรับผลิตภัณฑ์ของตน รวมถึงอเล็กซา การนี้เกิดขึ้นหลังจากมีรายงานว่าอมาซอนอาจลงทุนใน OpenAI ถึง 5 พันล้านดอลลาร์ โดยนักลงทุนอื่นที่อาจเข้าร่วม ได้แก่ Nvidia, Microsoft และ SoftBank โมเดลที่กำหนดเองนี้จะเสริมสร้างระบบนิเศษของอมาซอน ในขณะที่ OpenAIกดดันที่ต้องหาเงินทุนใหม่เนื่องจากการสัญญาระยะยาวกับผู้ให้บริการคลาวด์ที่มีมูลค่ามากกว่า 6 แสนล้านดอลลาร์

EN

Amazon is in discussions with OpenAI to develop customized AI models for its products, including Alexa. This follows reports of a potential $50 billion Amazon investment in OpenAI, with other potential investors including Nvidia, Microsoft, and SoftBank. The custom models would enhance Amazon's ecosystem while OpenAI faces pressure to secure new funding due to long-term cloud spending commitments totaling over $600 billion through the early 2030s.

Key Points

  • Amazon discussing custom AI models with OpenAI for Alexa and other products
  • Potential $50B Amazon investment in OpenAI with other investors including Nvidia, Microsoft, SoftBank
  • OpenAI faces pressure to secure funding due to long-term cloud spending commitments of $600B+ through early 2030s

Article

Discussions follow reports of a potential $50B Amazon investment as OpenAI balances cloud commitments and rival partnerships. Amazon has entered discussions with OpenAI on developing customized artificial intelligence models that could be used across Amazon’s AI products, according to a report from The Information. The talks come shortly after reports that Amazon may invest as much as $50 billion in OpenAI as part of a new fundraising round. Other participants in the round are said to include Nvidia, Microsoft, and SoftBank. Customized OpenAI models could be used to enhance Amazon products such as Alexa, potentially improving performance by tailoring responses and behavior to Amazon’s ecosystem and customer experience requirements. OpenAI emphasized its existing relationship with Amazon Web Services, saying it remains focused on a multiyear agreement valued at roughly $38 billion that gives OpenAI access to AWS infrastructure for running AI workloads. The potential collaboration adds another layer to Amazon’s AI strategy. The company maintains a close relationship with OpenAI rival Anthropic, whose models are used in Amazon-powered assistants and agents across shopping, coding, and data search. Any deeper engagement with OpenAI would place Amazon in the position of working with competing model providers to support different parts of its AI stack. The discussions also underscore pressure on OpenAI to secure significant new funding as it faces long-term spending commitments to cloud providers totaling more than $600 billion through the early 2030s.
